intro: Rinorea angustifolia subsp. ardisiiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rinorea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
